storyInfo: Theresa and Theresis convene the Royal Court sovereigns to formally establish the Military Commission. Meanwhile, with Kal'tsit's aid, Babel also begins its operations.

attributes.content: Autumn, 1031
The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
Hey, l-let me through already!
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Hey, no shoving! You want a good spot, I'll trade you mine for some high-purity Originium out of the mines.
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: Don't just grab the leaflet out of my hands! Eurgh, that blood all over you stinks...
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: Can't help it when you're breaking into dead people's houses. Lin...go...nes... That's how you read that word, right?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Where's Lingones?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Gaul.
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: Oh. Where's Gaul?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: How the *Sarkaz swearing* should I know where Gaul is?!
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: Hey, what's with the attitude?
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Shh! The Highnesses and the Royal Court bigshots are discussing something in the chamber. I heard it's about reorganizing the city. Haven't you noticed all the extra guards on the streets recently?
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: So quiet down a bit!
attributes.name: Impatient Civilian

attributes.content: *sigh* Weather's been real stuffy today.
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: It is decided.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Military Commission will replace the War Council in assisting the King of Sarkaz Theresa in decision-making related to Kazdel's military and political affairs.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Military Commission will be the sole administration of Kazdel, and none will have the authority to issue commands to the Sarkaz in the Royal Court's name.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: All present have already received the details of this resolution. To the Royal Court leaders who still wish to cling onto the War Council...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Know that the Military Commission of Kazdel will become the final bastion of the Sarkaz, our eternal fortress, and the usher of a new order.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Are there any further questions?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness appears more haggard than you did yesterday.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Please, look after your health. No Military Commission is worth it...
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: If it comes at the cost of Your Highness's health.
attributes.name: Banshee

attributes.content: Laqeramaline... thank you.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I know how hard you have worked for this day... and I also know how Kazdel today views the Banshees of the Convallis.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: But before I state our position, I encountered a lost envoy of the Liches on my journey here. He entrusted me with a letter for your Highnesses.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: That he couldn't even find the road here... let this be proof of the immense changes Kazdel has undergone.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Hmm... A letter from Leithanien.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If things are going as expected, Your Highness's Messenger would still not have received any news from the Cyclopes.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Rather than waiting for the response from deep in the blizzard, should we not hear how the Liches of Leithanien answer?
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: You're right. It has been... a very long time since the Sarkaz were able to truly unite.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The ornate calligraphy upon the letter turns into silken threads that float above the paper and weave into the shape of a familiar figure.
Fremont, a Lich who has long resided in Leithanien. It appears that he is now the 'First Scribe' for the Liches.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: It seems that the Arts practiced by the Liches of Leithanien have seen some stylistic changes. Oh, he appears rather excited.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Why is there only image, but no sound?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: The Lich envoy did suggest to me that he was rather vexed with refining his master's words, but never did I imagine that he would simply erase all the sound.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: In short, Fremont apologizes on behalf of the Liches. They are enthralled as ever by their quest for knowledge, and are therefore unable to afford the distraction of making the long journey here.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: But if Kazdel were ever in need of their knowledge, they would happily throw wide the gates to their temple for the people that they have chosen.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I am sure that with your abilities, your Highness can understand Fremont's attitude on the matter from his image alone. To me, it appears as though he is sensitive to drastic change, as has always been his wont.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Ah, yes. There is another letter from Fremont, one addressed directly to the General.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Might I remind you, Laqeramaline, that you are nobody's Messenger.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You have not yet expressed where the Banshee Court stands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I assumed that we had reached an understanding in the course of our reminiscing yesterday. The Banshees will not participate.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: We are still recovering from the wounds inflicted by the past war.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Perhaps other Sarkaz will castigate us for this, but all present should know that since that war, the elegies have yet to cease in our valley. We had suffered grievous losses.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: If Kazdel calls on the aid of the Banshees once more, then I will give the same promise as Fremont. The Banshees will be there.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: But until that day, you will find us willing but unable. Naturally, I myself will render what little assistance I am able to give, from this day onwards.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: That's more than we could ask for... Thank you, Laqeramaline.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You are welcome, Your Highness. You know where I stand. For the past hundred years, I have always stood by the decisions you have made.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: I can only hope that your brother does not blame us for watching from the sidelines.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Next, lord Nezzsalem, the Nachzehrer King.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You were once the leader of the War Council, and the mentor of Theresis and I.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What is your opinion on these many proposals? Where do the other council members that you represent stand on the matter?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Have you discussed them with the Damazti Cluster?
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: They have long since taken root in Kazdel, under many different names and faces. We have had many conversations over the years, and they have no objections.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Then I have no objections of my own.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Your Highness need not worry about the bureaucratic hurdles, policy imperfections, or enforcement mechanisms. Where I stand is also where the other members of the Council stand.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We all know what we truly long for. A turnabout. A change. A banner.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Go. Do as you will.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: We will, Nachzehrer King. I promise you that.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I trust that this stagnant and dulled 'war' can take on a new form in your hands.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I notice you have not said a word this entire meeting...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Sanguinarch of Vampires.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: To take the War Council and the century of history behind it...
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: ...And sweep it into the gutter alongside the exalted Heroic Age and what little triumphs within. Is that the General's decision?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: It is our decision.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Speak your mind, Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Duq'arael lowers his gaze.
Theresa's white skirt is mottled with many a blackened bloodstain.

The Sanguinarch is highly attuned to such matters. He senses the blood of the lowly, the foul stench of fallen descendants, and the murky taint of Royal Court members who willingly debased themselves.
I thank Your Highness, for purifying the filthy blood that I so abhor in my stead.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: But never have I needed to hide my requests behind honeyed words. Such as it has been for every King of the past, and so it will be for you.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The Military Commission is merely an attempt to hide Sarkaz witchcraft and blood behind a 'more modern, more efficient' name.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Truth be told, I feel like this is insignificant. More than insignificant, it is simply not necessary.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You reject the proposal...?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: On behalf of the Vampire Court?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Duq'arael glances at Theresis, but Theresis remains indifferent to him.
Time has left almost no trace on the mixed-blood Sarkaz.
He stands steadfast by Theresa's side, the same nameless warrior who stood by the seamstress a century ago.
His eyes never fall on the Vampire.
Not a rejection, no. I am merely expressing some minor frustrations about this meeting.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You are great and powerful, all of you are. How long has it been since so many members of the Royal Court have gathered here in Kazdel?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Not to mention that it was you who defeated that foolish coalition in the prior age and wrestled the future into your own hands, before personally establishing the War Council.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: And now you wish to personally 'change' this Council? Why?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Look about you at the other dignitaries in this chamber.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You have long reached a consensus. The only obstacle to your Military Commission is myself—and the Vampires.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: You would foist some ridiculous title upon me before forcing all Vampires to bow down to your Commission．
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: When did you learn this political trickery that those Victorians and Leithanians so love?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Why not just take my head here and now, and slaughter the Vampires within this city's walls?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: This meeting was not convened to persecute anyone.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Was it not?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: It was convened to discuss how to bring Kazdel into a new age—
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 'A new age'?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: In that so-called 'Age of the Six Heroes' the songs love to praise, what I saw was bloodthirst and violence.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I had thought that when I arrived in Kazdel, I would be greeted with the sound of Yliš's wailing, but what did I see instead?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I saw the coalition routed. Witchcraft, enough to cover the land and fill the skies, crushed the enemy front. The power of the Sarkaz shook the earth.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I felt amazement. I felt... excitement. Spurred by my passion, I took the head of the Leithanian envoy who had orchestrated the coalition and offered it to the War Council.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Nezzsalem!
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: That war was the true beginning of a new age. I thought you would agree with me.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Have you too succumbed to schemes and politics... and shut your ears to the echoes of the abyss?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The abyss has no place for you, Duq'arael. Do not drag me into your tantrum.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Ah, my apologies. But I am curious—what position did they offer the esteemed Sarkaz master of war in the Military Commission that has rendered even you so shortsighted?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: All I await is the next war.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: And what war would that be?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: If it pleases you, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Come, Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: I will show you.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Theresa nods her head in silent approval.
The King of Sarkaz's emotions envelop the entire chamber and all the members of the Royal Court.
Through the King's eyes, they see ruination and grief.

attributes.text: They see the century-old order that the Gaulish Empire so painstakingly maintained within the Core region obliterated by the combined forces of Ursus, Victoria, and Leithanien.
They see Lingones, the 'Capital of the World', doomed to never again appear on a map of Terra.

attributes.content: Those present recall the campaign that reduced Kazdel to dust.
But it is not yet over.
An even further future. An even further fantasy. An even further possibility.
It is no longer a story to reflect upon. Rather, it is a speculation, a deduction, a prediction, and a verdict.
But none question it, for all possibilities must be treated equally, even for the one they see.
And its ending is equally significant and indisputable as any other.
It is a change, a turning point in history, a divergence of fate.
A crucial war looms on the horizon. It will span from now into the distant future, impacting every Sarkaz and all of Terra.
All present has seen their positions in that war.
The roles that they wish to play.
You should understand now, Vampire. You should understand what these visions mean.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Or perhaps you have begun to grow weak and feeble as Yliš in the short span of a hundred years? You were once a warrior.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: ...I cannot deny that.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: But are you saying that a new and reborn Kazdel requires the Royal Court to relinquish its former authority?
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Close, but not quite.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The new Kazdel will no longer require the Royal Court's former authority.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It will be 'more modern, more efficient', Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: How can the Sarkaz speak of unity while you continue to indulge in your noble bloodlines? Will it come from the 'rule' of the Royal Court?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You may still rule over your own court, and maintain the power and prestige you hold among the Sarkaz, but the Vampire Court must yield to the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I promise you this, in Theresa's name.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: When the age that you witnessed comes, Kazdel will no longer be a single dot upon the map.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It was once more than just a city. And so it shall be more again.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It seems I have spoken out of turn. Please, continue, Your Highness Theresa.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: The aftermath of the ongoing conflict, enough to reshape current power dynamics, will engulf us all. It may come in fifty years, in ten, or perhaps even tomorrow...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Kazdel cannot escape it.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Damazti and I both saw the visions of the campaign that will destroy Lingones.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: High-efficiency command systems made possible by Originium Arts, high-speed battleships that can break through front lines, maneuver tactics that can mobilize entire legions... new advancements are applied to the battlefield as we speak.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Their capacity for destruction is surpassing our innate instinct rooted in our bloodlines.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What worries me more is the fact that we will still find fellow Sarkaz among the countless casualties of war.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Gaul employed Royal Court casters and the Liches in Leithanien are killing each other in battle, while a certain Wendigo is spilling the blood of his fellow Sarkaz to prove his loyalty to the Ursine Tsar.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: As for the Sarkaz mercenaries sent to the frontlines as Arts fodder, they won't even be counted in any nation's casualty statistics.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Sarkaz massacre one another in wars we have no stake in, regarded as disposable goods to be abandoned without care by the leaders of those wars.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: For the sake of keeping pace with these changes, the Sarkaz must once again gather around the furnace. And if necessary...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The power to dominate the war must lie in our hands.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresis looks to Theresa, waiting for her opinion.
But Theresa does not speak, her eyes placid, as before.
We will plunder the other nations, and wrest their most profound secrets from them.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: We were once the proud Teekaz, forced to become the Sarkaz and derided as devils...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Because the outlanders feared us. It is an ancient fear, rooted deep in their hearts.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Let us remind them. Let us show all of Terra our history and legend that have been either forgotten or falsified.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Sarkaz are not weak. We do not need others to save us from our fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: On the contrary, we will dictate the fate of Terra. Dictate how this land should move forward.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The details of our plan have been delivered to all present, through the runic Arts of the Banshees.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Duq'arael.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do you still hold doubt?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No. Exceptional work, Theresis. Set aside a seat on the Military Commission for the Crimson Court.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: It appears that our Nachzehrer King has not yet grown addled with age. But as to whether or not he could usher in such a grand feast...
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Warriors need not die in a blaze of glory. That is a vulgarity only chased by those who seek fame.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Oh, I nearly forgot you were still here, Laqeramaline.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: I have made myself abundantly clear from the start, Prince Duq'arael. I need only silently observe your... enthusiastic attempt at self-expression.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: How pitiful it is to look upon such a shabby little Court. I will cherish your elegies.
attributes.name: Duq'arael

attributes.content: Then this I promise you. When death comes for you, the Lord of the Banshees will sing you an elegy, delivered to you by the night wind.
attributes.name: Laqeramaline

attributes.content: Set aside your chatter for another time. It seems Their Highnesses still have matters to discuss.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The other members of the War Council will wish to know their decisions. Duq'arael, Laqeramaline, and you Damazti disguised outside the door, with me.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King nods his head towards Theresa.
The other two members of the Royal Court do not bid the King farewell. They simply follow the Nachzehrer King out of the chamber.
After the meeting's end, Theresis stays by Theresa's side, standing silently.
He knows that she will be expecting an answer from him.
You never mentioned that you would announce the plans for war to the Royal Court.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You did not refute me either.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Would I have been able to refute anything?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You are well aware of what I think. If you wanted to argue against any of it, you would have done so a few years ago.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: For now, I have them by the reins. But it's not just them, this entire city hungers for war.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will prevent matters from heading down the worst possible path... lest the prospects of Terra's continued existence become infinitesimally small.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You must be quick about it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What does Fremont's letter say?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: As Theresis opens the envelope, the writing vanishes before his eyes. Yet, the message has already etched itself indelibly into his mind.
He... has surmised what would transpire during that meeting rather accurately. He has given his opinion on some matters, alongside a reminder.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Do not place all your coming hopes in one basket.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The nomadic city of Kazdel, Kazdel
You with that Babel? Pah, don't count on the Military Commission to look after you all.
attributes.name: Snappy Civilian

attributes.content: We're here to help you.
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: Help us? My parents died at the hands of you Leithanians.
attributes.name: Snappy Civilian

attributes.content: You got some nerve. What, not scared of me?
attributes.name: Snappy Civilian

attributes.content: We knew what to expect when we came here. Just needs some getting used to.
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: Besides, our captain warned us not to agitate the locals.
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: You looking down on me?! *Sarkaz swearing*!
attributes.name: Snappy Civilian

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: The hell is this?! Let me go!
attributes.name: Snappy Civilian

attributes.content: (Welcoming wave)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Do not harm him, but do make him leave.
Dr. Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: I said not to deviate from our planned route, even if it is to treat the wounded along the way.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sorry, Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Newly-Arrived Medic

attributes.content: No matter. You handled it well. We've reached our destination.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Welcome to Babel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Babel Office, Kazdel
Did you manage to retrieve all our stray colleagues?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Yes. All's well with them.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The construction of Babel's facilities is proceeding smoothly. The school that you were so looking forward to is already complete.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yet I heard that the unbeatable Dr. Kal'tsit had not too long ago been turned down. Perhaps even kicked out?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I did not foresee such a... direct refusal.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm not surprised at all, to be honest. To many Sarkaz, the invitation of the King is barely worth the paper it's printed on.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: On the other hand, our 'connections' with Sargon and Rim Billiton have delivered good news. As for Columbia... Some scientists have proposed a technology exchange program.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They have their eyes on the ancient Sarkaz witchcraft, while we have need of their latest mobile farms.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It took us a century's effort to share an equal dialogue with these powers.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The results speak for themselves. You are creating new history, Theresa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Thank you, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But I can tell you've had a lot on your mind recently.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Military Commission has been formally established.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Babel's existence will spark yet another near-irreconcilable conflict in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Our staff comes from different races and nations. How should they live alongside the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If your efforts to soothe enmity and prejudice instead become a fuse to spark conflict anew, what does Your Highness plan to do?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If we cannot even eliminate prejudice and hatred within the walls of Kazdel, how can Babel hope to achieve equality for the Sarkaz throughout all of Terra?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There will be members of the Military Commission posted to Babel soon. They will ensure the safety of our people.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: This will also serve as a warning to some.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Babel is backed by both Theresis and me.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Oh, right! Did I ever tell you how I met a Sankta Messenger, Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Strange. The Sankta do not generally dare to approach the borders of Kazdel. Was this why Your Highness disappeared this afternoon?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Was it that obvious? I thought Laqeramaline had me covered.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Lord of the Banshees clearly tried, but judging from the results, she isn't the best pick for clerical work.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Well, what of that Sankta Messenger?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: He was getting water from the river, and we struck up a conversation. We chatted about many things. History, peace, hatred.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Our viewpoints did not align on most things, but I could sense in him wisdom and intelligence beyond his years.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: He had thoughts concealed within his heart, ones even he did not know of.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And so...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: You used the power of the King of Sarkaz on a Sankta?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I simply wished to know what this fated encounter meant.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: And... what did it mean?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's still hard to say. But while I was looking at his soul, I felt that, perhaps... we are not so alone, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Many on this land are doing all they can to pursue hope. Hopes big and small, hopes bright and beautiful.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Ugh... That hurt... Are those people nuts or something? I just wanted to get a few nice things for myself, never even heard of any Babel...
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: He steadies himself against the wall, gasping for air as his vision begins to blur.
Fatigue floods his limbs, weighing him down.
Through his blurred vision, he sees another in front of him fall to the crazed attackers' blades. He knows he will be next.
I refuse to die here...
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: It's you or me, you bastards! Out of the way!
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: He uses the last of his strength to barrel his way out, but the only resistance he meets is solid ground.
All he sees is black.
Are you alright? Were you trying to save me just now?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: There's so much blood. Why does it feel like I'm the one saving you?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Hold on, I'll bring you to Babel! Our doctors there can help you!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Hah... I'm still alive...
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Hmph, who would have thought that those lunatics would decide to attack innocent bystanders in broad daylight to get at Babel. I don't know how the others are faring...
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: Hey, hey! Stay with me! I still don't know your name!
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I'm... Good...luck...
attributes.name: Goodluck

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Woman's Voice

attributes.content: For the first time, he regrets giving himself this name.
